intro: Agelaea poggeana, commonly known as the Hawaiian treefern, is a species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, compound fronds. The plant has a unique structure with a central trunk covered in a mass of roots and rhizomes, giving it a tree-like appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Agelaea poggeana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
